children.name: total b1
children.definition: total  the number or amount that there is, when everything has been counted or added together:tổng số
examples: you had 29 points plus 33 points, so the total is 62.
a company spokesperson said 28,000 jobs or 70% of the total will be cut.
total of
the three defendants were jailed for a total of 30 years.
a total of $950 million was spent on the new transportation system
total[attri adj] [b1] the totalnumberoramountis the number that there is when everything has been counted and added together:toàn bộ ,tổng cộng
total number/amount/cost etc
total sales of 200,000 per year
her total income was £10,000 a year.
the total cost was far higher than we had expected.
people of chinese origin made up about 10% of the total population.
the performing arts department’s total budget for the year was $6.3 million.

children.name: altogether b1
children.definition: altogether/ in all use this tosayoraskwhat a total amount is, including everything that could be included:cả thảy, tất cả
examples: altogether 680 women took part in the conference.
on the wall are rows of stickers, 35 in all, each representing a team victory.

children.name: grand total x
children.definition: grand total the total when everything has been included - use this especially in a humorous way when the final total is surprisingly small:tổng cộngcó bao nhiêu thôi
examples: the grand total for both meals was $6.73.
grand total of
a grand total of six people showed up for the lecture.
the school bazaar raised a/the grand total of £550.

children.name: subtotal x
children.definition: subtotal the total of a single set of figures, for example on a bill, which does not include other amounts that will be added later to make the final total:tổng số phụ
examples: the subtotal for parts was $23. with labor costs, the bill came to $36.
you have to add the cost of postage to the subtotal.

children.name: to calculate an amount or price
estimate b2
children.definition: estimate to guess an amount, price, or number as exactly as you can: dự tính, ước đoán
examples: analysts estimate the business earned about $135 million last year.
estimate that
the police department estimates that the number of violent crimes will increase this year by about 15%.
estimate sth to be sth
at that point, the public sector deficit was estimated to be around £45 billion.
estimate sth at sth
industry sources estimate the value of the ranch at $7 million.
estimate how much/how many/how far etc
our staff will help you estimate how much fabric you will require

children.name: calculate b2
children.definition: calculate to find out how much sth will cost, how long sth will take etc by using numbers:tính ( hết bao nhiêu tiền, thời gian....)
examples: their accountant calculated the total cost of the project.
calculate how much/ how many/ how far etc
i began calculating how long it would take to get to the airport if i left at 4:00.
calculate that
sally calculated that she needed $300 to pay all her bills.

children.name: work out b2
children.definition: work out/figureout  to calculate an answer, amount, price, or value:
examples: tính ra ( một cau hỏi, số lượng, giá cả, giá trị )
work/figure out sth
i always use a calculator to work out percentages.
has anyone been able to figure out the answer to number seven?
work/figure sth out
‘how much do i owe you?’ ‘i haven’t worked it out yet.’
work out how much/how many/how far etc
we need to work out how much food we’ll need to take with us.
i spent all of last night trying to figure out how much this wedding is going to cost me.

children.name: make x
children.definition: make to calculate a particular total :
examples: make it 250/20 kilos/$50 etc
‘how much do i owe you for the meal?’ ‘i make it $10.50.’
will you count these figures again? i make the total 248, but chris made it 249.

children.name: figure x
children.definition: figure  to calculate an amount :tính ra/tìm ra
examples: he needs to sit down and figure out how many people are coming.
there has been criticism about the current method for figuring social security retirement benefits.

children.name: assess b2
children.definition: assess to calculate the value or cost of sth : định giá
examples: be assessed at sth
the value of the business was assessed at £1.25 million.
assessment[c or u] b2 a calculation about the cost or value of sth : định giá
a tax assessment

children.name: when several numbers produce another number as a total
come to b2
children.definition: come to sth to be the total amount when everything is counted:lên đến
examples: including wine, the bill came to $70.
total profits from all sources for the year came to about $15 million.

children.name: reach b2
children.definition: reach if a total reaches 10, 50, 100 etc, it increases until it is equal to that number:lên đến, đạt
examples: hurricane damage could reach billions of dollars.
china’s economic output is likely to reach $13 trillion within the next few years.
the city’s population is expected to reach 12 million by the year 2010.

children.name: make x
children.definition: make if numbers added together make 10, 50, 100 etc, that is the answer or the total:
examples: tạo thành
two plus two makes four.
if jane comes, that will make six of us.
there are eight submarines as well as the ships, making a total fleet of 34.

children.name: add up to x
children.definition: add up to ifa set of several figuresadds up to 10, 50 etc, that is the total when you add them all together:cộng lại thành
examples: the three angles of a triangle add up to 180 degrees.
if you follow the diet exactly, it adds up to about 1,200 calories per day.
with the hotel, the flights, and the food, it all added up to much more than i had expected.
just 200 extra calories each day add up to one-half pound of extra body fat each week.

children.name: amount to x
children.definition: amount to sth to reach a total, especially a large total:lên đến
examples: credit card fraud amounts to about $17 million a year.
nationally, deaths from smoking-related illnesses amount to about 30 people each day.
a thousand-word essay might amount to roughly 6,000 bytes on a computer disk.

children.name: total c1
children.definition: total to reach a particular total - used especially in official contexts:lên tới
examples: the company was forced to pay fines and penalties totalling $24.8.
the number of people included in the study totalled 170.

children.name: number c2
children.definition: number if a group of people or things numbers a particular figure, especially a large figure, that is the total when they are all included:tổng cộng là, cộng lại thành
examples: the crowd of students numbered at least 2000.
in the capital, unemployed workers now number 12% of the workforce.

children.name: overestimate c1
children.definition: overestimate to wronglyguessan amount, price or number by making the total too high:tính quá mức
examples: i made enough food for forty people but it looks like i overestimated.
a harvard university survey found that americans significantly overestimate the cost of higher education.

children.name: miscalculate x
children.definition: miscalculatetính nhầm
examples: we have too many chairs. i must have miscalculated.
the city miscalculated the cost of earthquake repairs for the bay bridge.
miscalculate how much/how many/how long etc
sorry we’re late - we miscalculated how long it would take to get here.
miscalculationnoun[ c or u ] sự tính sai, sự tính nhầm
the project went over budget because of a miscalculation at the planning stage.
the conspirators' plot failed because theymadetwo fatal miscalculations.

children.name: underestimate b2
children.definition: underestimate to wrongly guess an amount, price, or number by making it too low:tính qua thấp
examples: we saved about $1000 for our trip but we underestimated and may have to wait until next year to go.
early mapmakers often underestimated the earth’s circumference.

children.name: calculation b2
children.definition: calculationphép toán, phép tính
examples: this type of calculation would take several hours without a computer.
according to our calculations, 2000 jobs will be lost.
do/ make a calculation
mickey sat at the kitchen table doing calculations on a scratch pad.
once all the necessary calculations have been made the experiment can proceed.

children.name: sum x
children.definition: sum  asimplecalculation, especially one done by children as an exercise in school: phép toán số học
examples: it’ll be quicker if i use a calculator for these sums.
we had to do some really hard sums today.
i remember how much i hateddoingsums when i was at school.

children.name: estimate b2
children.definition: estimate what you think the number, price, or value of sth probably is, after calculating it quickly :ước tính, ước đoán
examples: i’m allowing $300, but that’s only an estimate.
estimate of
officials said huntcor’s estimate of building costs was about $3 million more than expected.
rough estimatenot exact but good enough to be useful:ước tính sơ bộ
this proposal represents a rough estimate of the cost of materials and labor.
conservativeestimatean estimate that is probablytoolow, so you can be sure that the true amount will not be less than this:ước tính dè dặt
the paintings have been valued at $3.5 million, which is probably a conservative estimate.
estimated[attri adj] [b2]
an estimated number/cost/value etca number, cost etc that is not exact but has been roughly calculated:ước tính/ ước lượng
the tunnel is being constructed at an estimated cost of £15 million.
an estimated 1 million irish people died from starvation and disease during the famine.

children.name: equation c1
children.definition: equation a mathematical statement in which you show that two amounts are equal using mathematical symbols : phương trình
examples: in the equation 3x - 3 = 15, x = 6.

children.name: operation x
children.definition: operation specialized a mathematical process, such as addition, in which one set of numbers is produced from another: phép tính; phép toán

children.name: formula c1
children.definition: formula a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule :
examples: the formula for calculating distance
sugar is represented by the simple formula cho.
we had to learn chemical formulae at school, but i can only remember h 2 o for water.

children.name: matrix x
children.definition: matrix  an arrangement of numbers, letters, or signs in rows and column s that you consider to be one amount, and that you use in solving mathematical problems : ma trận
examples: a matrix table

children.name: axiom x
children.definition: axiom a formal statement or principle in mathematics, science, etc., from which other statements can be obtained: tiên đề
examples: euclid's axioms form the foundation of his system of geometry.

children.name: algorithm x
children.definition: algorithm a set of mathematical instructions that must be followed in a fixed order, and that, especially if given to a computer, will help to calculate an answer to a mathematical problem: thuật toán
